refnamediv.refpurpose: a class that uses the SMT solver Ario to solve propositional formulas

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The class &class_smt_solver_ario; inherits from the class &class_smt_lib_solver;. It uses the SMT solver &solver_ario; to determine the satisfiability of propositional formulas. To use the solver &solver_ario;, the directory containing the corresponding executable must be in the path. On June the 20th of 2006, &solver_ario; was available on &link_ario;.
The constructor &smt_solver_ario_constructor; checks if &solver_ario;'s executable is indeed available and reports an error if it is not.
The method &smt_solver_ario_is_satisfiable; receives a propositional formula in conjunctive normal form as parameter &par_formula; and indicates whether or not this formula is satisfiable.

refsect1.title: Preconditions
refsect1.para:
The following precondition has to be satisfied for &smt_solver_ario_is_satisfiable;:
The argument passed as parameter &par_formula; is a list of propositional formulas in internal mCRL2 format. The argument represents a formula in conjunctive normal form, where the elements of the list represent the clauses
